newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivorian coffee bean exports rise in April.
newsitem.headline: Ivorian coffee bean exports rise in April.

text.p: Ivory Coast exported 23,324 tonnes of robusta coffee beans in April 1996/97 (Oct-Sept) against 16,307 tonnes in March, and 21,918 in April 1996, official shipping data show.
Ivorian coffee exports got off to a late start in 1996/97 after low world prices in late 1996, tighter bank lending policies to exporters and quality problems slowing grading, exporters said.
The 1996/97 crop is the largest since the early 1980s.
The data showed 21,500 tonnes of April exports went from Abidjan, the main port, with 1,824 tonnes shipped from Ivory Coast's second port, San Pedro.
Cumulative bean exports in the first seven months of the 1996/97 (Oct-Sept) season were 62,090 tonnes against 81,808 tonnes in the same period of 1995/96, and 56,866 in 1994/95.
Coffee product exports, from Abidjan, included 1,171 tonnes of soluble coffee and six tonnes of roasted coffee.
Ivory Coast forecast a 1996/97 crop of 230,000 tonnes against 180,000 tonnes recorded last year. Port sources put arrivals by late June 1997 at around 300,000 tonnes.
